result.execSummary:
Jordan William Salmela was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Jordan William Salmela was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan William Salmela

defendant.name: Salmela, Jordan William
defendant.address: 3934 First Avenue S. Apt. 5, Minneapolis, MN 55409

records.addlTxt: Copy of criminal complaint and waiver of extradition was mailed to Governor's office.
This did not take place. Court event needs to be in court record to dispose of case.

01:17 PM Defendant Jordan William Salmela in court, in custody.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge Radtke and DAR appeared via zoom. Court goes over defendant's right for extradition.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Defendant wishes to waive extradition and return to the State of Minnesota. Defendant signs waiver of extradtion.  COURT ACCEPTS waiver of extraditon, FINDS DEFENDANT FREELY, VOLUNTARILY AND KNOWINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court will sign waiver when presented. 1:21
